description: A group of 3 yakuza failed their boss for the last time. After messing up an important job, the boss gave them 2 choices: Honorably committing suicide, or go to Thailand to get a sex reassignment surgery in order to become "female" idols. After a gruesome year long training to become idols, they successfully debut, with overwhelming popularity, much to their dismay. This is where their tragedy truly begins.
hashtag: #アニメBSG #ゴクドルズ #BackStreetGirls #バックストリートガールズ
synonyms: Back Street Girls: Washira Idol Hajimemashita

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Yakuza
tags.description: Centered around Japanese organised crime syndicates.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

node.description: A Japanese anime director, storyboard artist, and animator.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

**Birthplace:** Los Angeles, California
**Spouse:** Rachel Robinson (2019-)

**Introduction:**
Christopher Bevins, alternatively known as Chris Bevins is an American voice actor, ADR director and script/screenwriter. He is more known for his work as an ADR director at FUNimation Productions in Dallas/Fort Worth, Texas.

**Non-anime roles:**
~!- Dhalsim and Soldier A (David) in "Street Fighter V" (VG)
- Dhalsim in "Street Fighter IV" (VG)
- Dhalsim in "Street Fighter X Tekken" (VG)
- Koga, Brycen and Swimmer in "Pokémon Masters" (VG)
- Legault in "Fire Emblem Heroes" (VG)
- Nadai in "Fist of the North Star: Lost Paradise" (VG)
- Shishiwakamaru in "Yu Yu Hakusho: Dark Tournament" (VG)
- Voice in "FUNimation" (logo bumper)
!~
**Non-anime staff credits:**
~!- Script Adaptation for "Sengoku Basara: Samurai Heroes" (VG)!~

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/jussaramarques/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Jussara44820803) | [Facebook](https://facebook.com/jussaramarquesatriz) | [IMDb](https://www.imdb.com/name/nm3779142)

Jussara Marques de Oliveira is a Brazilian actress, voice actress and dubbing director.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Debby Ryan (Most of the productions)
- Rebeka "Rebe" Parrilla de Bormujo Ávalos (Elite)
- Valkyrie (Marvel Cinematic Universe)
- Jett (Valorant)
- Eloise Bridgerton (Bridgerton)
- Helga Geraldine Pataki (Hey Arnold!)
- Kelsi Willow Nielsen (High School Musical trilogy)
- Mari (Grand Chase and Grand Chase Dimensional Chaser)
- Cobalt-B and Rubilia (Tower of Fantasy)
- Assistant Mayor Dawn Bellwether (Zootopia)
- Danielle Curtin (Prison Break)
- Frankie (The Walking Dead)
- Haley Gwendolyn Dunphy (1st voice - 1st-6th season; Modern Family)
- Emily Elizabeth Howard (1st dub; Clifford the Big Red Dog)
- Jade Chan (1st voice; Jackie Chan Adventures)
- Angel Salvadore (X-Men: First Class)
- Nele Springer (Cyberpunk 2077: Phantom Liberty)
- Brianna G. Buttowski (Kick Buttowski: Suburban Daredevil)
!~

Website | Twitter Introduction Masayoshi Ooishi is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer, arranger and guitarist. He is currently a lead vocalist and guitarist for the band Sound Schedule, which is a three-piece J-pop/rock/jazz band. He is also a part of the duo [OxT](https://anilist.co/staff/127401/OxT) (Ooishi x Tom-H@ck), with Oshima Tomohiro. Biography Since making his major debut as a vocalist and guitarist for the band Sound Schedule in 2001, he has left numerous works as a musician. His outstanding voice, which has revealed itself to be capable of touching the hearts of many, worldwide, and while having his performance evaluated by the people, as a part of a new band at the time, he got to appear on music-themed programs on TV, and on numerous unusual music stations, while also participating in festivals nationwide. In 2008, he made his solo debut as "Masayoshi Ooishi". His way of playing the acoustic guitar was said to be a masterpiece of its own, and as a solo artist to debut with that as a reputation, it made it all the more interesting for him. There are various ways to describe him as a musician, some call him a "hand magician", or a "one-person amusement park", some even say it's like watching a magic trick. Not only does he perform live at the country's floorboard, he also performs on the internet on sites such as YouTube and Nico Nico Douga, where he attracts lots of attention from all generations alike, but he's a lot more popular with the younger generation.
